text: one of the greatest benefits having a
composting toilet is never needing a
black tank again so I'm going to show
you the most ridiculously simple way to
combine your black and gray tanks when
we first installed the toilet I thought
about these crazy ideas of how to
combine the black and gray tank and I
couldn't quite decide on one I was
hanging out with her friends the RV
geeks and they said hey why don't you
just add a knife valve and I thought duh
how easy is that
so I confirmed a Fleetwood they said
it's totally cool doesn't matter you can
do it so I'm going to show you simple
simple solution so this is called a
3-inch gate valve or twist on waist
valve it's just like the ones installed
in your RV except it has this bayonet
mount so you can put it directly on your
sewer connection so this extra valve
just mounts on just like you would a
sewer hose and notice that this is kind
of in the way here but fortunately it
swings around like that okay and I've
also added a clear 45 degree so I can
see what's coming out and it gives me a
better angle to connect my sewer hose
this is where it gets a little bit weird
you can move this all around so you can
actually get your sewer hose connected
just like that it's real tight fit
but that's good you want to type it okay
we're ready to combine the black and
gray tank so we have our black tank here
and our grey tank here how I like to use
it as they let the grey tank fill up
which is about 50 gallons I make sure
this valve is closed here I pull open
the grey and then I pull open the black
now what that does is it's Auto leveling
so water is coming out of the gray and
filling up the black one very important
thing to keep in mind is do not leave
the black open the whole time the last
thing you want is water coming up
filling the black tank all together and
then flowing inside your RV so I always
keep my black tank closed and I just
dump the grey and open the grey as
necessary to level it out for safety
reasons I never let my black tank get
over 2/3 so I keep a real close eye on
my levels while I'm doing this so this
setups great for boon dogging but it's
also great for campgrounds that don't
have a sewer connection so when it comes
time to dump I open the grey make sure
it's open and pull the main valve open
the black again and the best part is
it's just gray water so there's no
stinky sewerage snow once you're done
with the dump make sure all your valves
are closed and that's the most
ridiculously easy way to combine your
black and grey tank
you
